As [S͢ky D͢ream][1] said, it cannot be done. But there **IS** workaround! You can create custom `Toast` which can contain any `View`. That means you can have layout with *two* messages on *different* places inside one toast.

You can find how to do that [here][2], or you can start directly with this snippet:

    LayoutInflater inflater = getLayoutInflater();
    View layout = inflater.inflate(R.layout.custom_toast,
                               (ViewGroup) findViewById(R.id.toast_layout_root));

    TextView text = (TextView) layout.findViewById(R.id.text);
    text.setText("This is a custom toast");

    Toast toast = new Toast(getApplicationContext());
    toast.setGravity(Gravity.CENTER_VERTICAL, 0, 0);
    toast.setDuration(Toast.LENGTH_LONG);
    toast.setView(layout);
    toast.show();


  [1]: http://stackoverflow.com/users/1153551/s%CD%A2ky-d%CD%A2ream
  [2]: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/notifiers/toasts.html#CustomToastView
